author: potuz
content: Fees will be redirected to the coinbase stated in the application block. If the validator proposing that block is running the execution engine then he can decide whatever address he wants

author: protolambda
content: No ban/kick, just deleted a message above. I don't think we should self-advertise NFTs in this server. I'll try clarify the rules.

author: bronzillionaire
content: <@203220829473996800> ok so can i atleast share my eth wallet address here, im trying to raise some funds?

author: potuz
content: <@!489217181104734219> the thing is that a single eth1 node is forking when different consensus engines ask for it to produce blocks. So it may be tricky for Infura to prevent these forks when they are serving tons of eth2 nodes requesting blocks at the same time. In their case is not a problem cause they will be conencted to other eth1 nodes. In our local setup the eth1 node is not connected to anything but the eth2 nodes

author: schone_wizard
content: The end of your answer confused me. Is the problem when the eth1 node is working with other eth1 nodes or when itâ€™s not connected to other eth1 nodes? <@755590043632140352>

author: schone_wizard
content: If itâ€™s the latter. I thought having our eth1 nodes standalone was a devnet thing only. I didnâ€™t imagine that to be the case for production/main net

author: protolambda
content: <@!770250684960342036> No. The line between raising funds and advertisement/scams is too blurry when there is no context. I draw the line at fund raising for ethereum ecosystem improvement. Anything more is just not necessary in this server.

author: bronzillionaire
content: Which is why i posted my nft collection to show that I'm legit. You could see my artworks there. But yes I do understand this server limits and respect them. Thank you for your time.
